description.narrative:
Because SOMO participates in relevant international networks, including OECD Watch and MVO Platform of which SOMO is the host organization, and European Coalition for Corporate Justice (ECCJ), we are goond independent knowledge institute and has been researching multinational companies and the impact of their activities on people and the environment for almost 50 years. In addition, SOMO supports communities and workers worldwide to receive redress if they have been damaged by these business activities.
As a knowledge institute, SOMO has extensive experience in drawing up ICSR covenants. For example, we contributed to the covenants for the banking sector, metal chains, clothing and textiles, pension funds and the insurance sector. SOMO's role in this is to advise and support civil society organizations, unions, companies and the government based on our knowledge and expertise in the field of due diligence, international standards (UNGPs and OECD guidelines) and CSR in the various sectors. SOMO does not see itself as an executing party in the covenants. We do see ourselves as an independent, social organization that is committed to achieving good, effective covenants by supporting the participating parties in the covenants.
The request of various parties (including ActionAid, the North Sea Foundation, FNV / CNV, Eneco and the SER) to support them with knowledge, expertise and advice (in all phases of the implementation of the ICSR covenant for the wind energy sector). covenant process, from exploration to negotiation / realization to implementation). SOMO has extensively researched the (wind) energy chain, including a recently conducted sector-mapping study for this project (Human rights in wind turbine supply chains 2018 <(>&<)> 2019 commissioned by ActionAid). Our experience with communities and workers who have been negatively impacted by the activities of companies in the wind energy chain can be put to good use.
For the period April to October 2020, we want to support the process by participating in the working groups due diligence and governance. We also want to be able to carry out short research assignments to provide the various parties with the most current and relevant figures, facts and information.

participating-org.narrative: SOMO is an independent, not-for-profit research and network organization working on social, ecological and economic issues related to sustainable development. Since 1973, the organization investigates multinational corporations and the consequences of their activities for people and the environment around the world.
